00064 /*=========================================================================

00076 static char *
00077 filter_odd_name (char *name)
00078 {
00079   char *ret = name;
00080   while (name[0])
00081     {
00082       /* A host name should never contain any slash. But we never  know */
00083       if (name[0] == '/')
00084         name[0] = '_';
00085       name++;
00086     }
00087   return ret;
00088 }

00097 static gchar *
00098 kb_dirname (void)
00099 {
00100   return g_build_filename (OPENVAS_STATE_DIR, "kbs", NULL);
00101 }
00102 
00108 static int
00109 kb_mkdir (char *dir)
00110 {
00111   char *t;
00112   int ret = 0;
00113 
00114   dir = estrdup (dir);
00115   t = strchr (dir + 1, '/');
00116   while (t)
00117     {
00118       t[0] = '\0';
00119       mkdir (dir, 0700);
00120       t[0] = '/';
00121       t = strchr (t + 1, '/');
00122     }
00123 
00124   if ((ret = mkdir (dir, 0700)) < 0)
00125     {
00126       if (errno != EEXIST)
00127         log_write ("mkdir(%s) failed : %s\n", dir, strerror (errno));
00128       efree (&dir);
00129       return ret;
00130     }
00131   efree (&dir);
00132   return ret;
00133 }
00134 
00135 
00142 static char *
00143 kb_fname (char *hostname)
00144 {
00145   gchar *dir = kb_dirname ();
00146   char *ret;
00147   char *hn = strdup (hostname);
00148 
00149   hn = filter_odd_name (hn);
00150 
00152   ret = emalloc (strlen (dir) + strlen (hn) + 2);
00153   sprintf (ret, "%s/%s", dir, hn);
00154   g_free (dir);
00155   efree (&hn);
00156   return ret;
00157 }

00160 /*
00161  * mmap() tends to sometimes act weirdly
00162  */
00163 static char *
00164 map_file (int file)
00165 {
00166   struct stat st;
00167   char *ret;
00168   int i = 0;
00169   int len;
00170 
00171   bzero (&st, sizeof (st));
00172   fstat (file, &st);
00173   len = (int) st.st_size;
00174   if (len == 0)
00175     return NULL;
00176 
00177   lseek (file, 0, SEEK_SET);
00178   ret = emalloc (len + 1);
00179   while (i < len)
00180     {
00181       int e = read (file, ret + i, len - i);
00182       if (e > 0)
00183         i += e;
00184       else
00185         {
00186           log_write ("read(%d, buf, %d) failed : %s\n", file, len,
00187                      strerror (errno));
00188           efree (&ret);
00189           lseek (file, len, SEEK_SET);
00190           return NULL;
00191         }
00192     }
00193 
00194   lseek (file, len, SEEK_SET);
00195   return ret;
00196 }

00198 static int
00199 save_kb_entry_present_already (struct arglist *globals, char *name, char *value)
00200 {
00201   char *buf;
00202   int fd;
00203   char *req;
00204 
00205   fd = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (globals, "save_kb"));
00206   if (fd <= 0)
00207     return -1;
00208 
00209   buf = map_file (fd);
00210   if (buf)
00211     {
00212       int ret;
00213       req = emalloc (strlen (name) + strlen (value) + 2);
00214       sprintf (req, "%s=%s", name, value);
00215       if (strstr (buf, req))
00216         ret = 1;
00217       else
00218         ret = 0;
00219       efree (&buf);
00220       efree (&req);
00221       return ret;
00222     }
00223   return -1;
00224 }
00225 
00226 static int
00227 save_kb_rm_entry_value (struct arglist *globals, char *name, char *value)
00228 {
00229   char *buf;
00230   int fd;
00231   char *req;
00232 
00233 
00234   fd = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (globals, "save_kb"));
00235   if (fd <= 0)
00236     return -1;
00237 
00238   buf = map_file (fd);
00239   if (buf)
00240     {
00241       char *t;
00242       if (value)
00243         {
00244           req = emalloc (strlen (name) + strlen (value) + 2);
00245           sprintf (req, "%s=%s", name, value);
00246         }
00247       else
00248         req = estrdup (name);
00249 
00250       t = strstr (buf, req);
00251       if (t)
00252         {
00253           char *end;
00254 
00255           while (t[0] != '\n')
00256             {
00257               if (t == buf)
00258                 break;
00259               else
00260                 t--;
00261             }
00262 
00263           if (t[0] == '\n')
00264             t++;
00265           end = strchr (t, '\n');
00266           t[0] = '\0';
00267           if (end)
00268             {
00269               end[0] = '\0';
00270               end++;
00271             }
00272 
00273           if ((lseek (fd, 0, SEEK_SET)) < 0)
00274             {
00275               log_write ("lseek() failed - %s\n", strerror (errno));
00276             }
00277 
00278           if ((ftruncate (fd, 0)) < 0)
00279             {
00280               log_write ("ftruncate() failed - %s\n", strerror (errno));
00281             }
00282 
00283 
00284           if (write (fd, buf, strlen (buf)) < 0)
00285             {
00286               log_write ("write() failed - %s\n", strerror (errno));
00287             }
00288 
00289           if (end)
00290             {
00291               if ((write (fd, end, strlen (end))) < 0)
00292                 log_write ("write() failed - %s\n", strerror (errno));
00293             }
00294         }
00295       efree (&buf);
00296       efree (&req);
00297       lseek (fd, 0, SEEK_END);
00298     }
00299   return 0;
00300 }
00301 
00302 static int
00303 save_kb_rm_entry (struct arglist *globals, char *name)
00304 {
00305   return save_kb_rm_entry_value (globals, name, NULL);
00306 }
00307 
00329 static int
00330 save_kb_write (struct arglist *globals, char *hostname, char *name, char *value,
00331                int type)
00332 {
00333   int fd;
00334   char *str;
00335   int e;
00336   struct timeval now;
00337 
00338   if (!globals || !hostname || !name || !value)
00339     return -1;
00340 
00341   fd = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (globals, "save_kb"));
00342   if (fd <= 0)
00343     {
00344       log_write ("Can not find KB fd for %s\n", hostname);
00345       return -1;
00346     }
00347 
00348   /* Skip temporary KB entries */
00349   if (!strncmp (name, "/tmp/", 4) || !strncmp (name, "NIDS/", 5)
00350       || !strncmp (name, "Settings/", 9))
00351     return 0;
00352 
00353   /* Don't save sensitive information */
00354   if (strncmp (name, "Secret/", 7) == 0)
00355     return 0;
00356 
00357   /* Avoid duplicates for these families */
00358   if (!strncmp (name, "Success/", strlen ("Success/"))
00359       || !strncmp (name, "Launched/", strlen ("Launched/"))
00360       || !strncmp (name, "SentData/", strlen ("SentData/")))
00361     {
00362       save_kb_rm_entry (globals, name);
00363     }
00364 
00365   if (save_kb_entry_present_already (globals, name, value))
00366     {
00367       save_kb_rm_entry_value (globals, name, value);
00368     }
00369 
00370   str = emalloc (strlen (name) + strlen (value) + 25);
00371   gettimeofday (&now, NULL);
00372   sprintf (str, "%ld %d %s=%s\n", (long) now.tv_sec, type, name, value);
00373 
00377   e = write (fd, str, strlen (str));
00378   if (e < 0)
00379     {
00380       log_write ("Write kb error - %s\n", strerror (errno));
00381     }
00382   efree (&str);
00383   return 0;
00384 }

00389                    Public functions

00392 
00402 int
00403 save_kb_new (struct arglist *globals, char *hostname)
00404 {
00405   char *fname;
00406   char *dir;
00407   int f;
00408 
00409   if (hostname == NULL)
00410     return -1;
00411 
00412   dir = kb_dirname ();
00413   kb_mkdir (dir);
00414   efree (&dir);
00415 
00416   fname = kb_fname (hostname);
00417 
00418   if (file_locked (fname))
00419     {
00420       efree (&fname);
00421       return 0;
00422     }
00423   unlink (fname);               /* delete the previous kb */
00424   f = open (fname, O_CREAT | O_RDWR | O_EXCL, 0640);
00425   if (f < 0)
00426     {
00427       log_write ("Can not save KB for %s - %s", hostname,
00428                  strerror (errno));
00429       efree (&fname);
00430       return -1;
00431     }
00432   else
00433     {
00434       file_lock (fname);
00435       log_write ("New KB will be saved as %s", fname);
00436       if (arg_get_value (globals, "save_kb"))
00437         arg_set_value (globals, "save_kb", sizeof (gpointer),
00438                        GSIZE_TO_POINTER (f));
00439       else
00440         arg_add_value (globals, "save_kb", ARG_INT, sizeof (gpointer),
00441                        GSIZE_TO_POINTER (f));
00442     }
00443   return 0;
00444 }
00445 
00446 
00447 void
00448 save_kb_close (struct arglist *globals, char *hostname)
00449 {
00450   int fd = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (globals, "save_kb"));
00451   char *fname = kb_fname (hostname);
00452   if (fd > 0)
00453     close (fd);
00454   file_unlock (fname);
00455   efree (&fname);
00456 }
00457 
00463 int
00464 save_kb_exists (char *hostname)
00465 {
00466   char *fname = kb_fname (hostname);
00467   FILE *f;
00468 
00469   if (file_locked (fname))
00470     {
00471       efree (&fname);
00472       return 0;
00473     }
00474   f = fopen (fname, "r");
00475   efree (&fname);
00476   if (!f)
00477     return 0;
00478   else
00479     {
00480       fclose (f);
00481       return 1;
00482     }
00483 }

00486 int
00487 save_kb_write_str (struct arglist *globals, char *hostname, char *name,
00488                    char *value)
00489 {
00490   char *newvalue = addslashes (value);
00491   int e;
00492 
00493   e = save_kb_write (globals, hostname, name, newvalue, ARG_STRING);
00494   efree (&newvalue);
00495   return e;
00496 }

00498 
00499 int
00500 save_kb_write_int (struct arglist *globals, char *hostname, char *name,
00501                    int value)
00502 {
00503   static char asc_value[25];
00504   int e;
00505   sprintf (asc_value, "%d", value);
00506   e = save_kb_write (globals, hostname, name, asc_value, ARG_INT);
00507   bzero (asc_value, sizeof (asc_value));
00508   return e;
00509 }

00516 int
00517 save_kb_restore_backup (char *hostname)
00518 {
00519   char *fname = kb_fname (hostname);
00520   char *bakname;
00521   int fd;
00522 
00523   bakname = emalloc (strlen (fname) + 5);
00524   strcat (bakname, fname);
00525   strcat (bakname, ".bak");
00526 
00527   unlink (fname);
00528   if ((fd = open (bakname, O_RDONLY)) >= 0)
00529     {
00530       close (fd);
00531       rename (bakname, fname);
00532     }
00533   return 0;
00534 }
00535 
00539 int
00540 save_kb_backup (char *hostname)
00541 {
00542   char *fname = kb_fname (hostname);
00543   char *newname = NULL;
00544   int fd_src = -1, fd_dst = -1;
00545 
00546   if (file_locked (fname))
00547     {
00548       log_write ("%s is locked\n", fname);
00549       goto failed1;
00550     }
00551 
00552   file_lock (fname);
00553 
00554   newname = emalloc (strlen (fname) + 5);
00555   strcat (newname, fname);
00556   strcat (newname, ".bak");
00557 
00558   if ((fd_src = open (fname, O_RDONLY)) >= 0)
00559     {
00560       char buf[4096];
00561       int n;
00562       fd_dst = open (newname, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC, 0640);
00563       if (fd_dst < 0)
00564         {
00565           log_write ("save_kb_backup failed : %s", strerror (errno));
00566           close (fd_src);
00567           goto failed;
00568         }
00569       bzero (buf, sizeof (buf));
00570       while ((n = read (fd_src, buf, sizeof (buf))) > 0)
00571         {
00572           int m = 0;
00573           while (m != n)
00574             {
00575               int e = write (fd_dst, &(buf[m]), n - m);
00576               if (e < 0)
00577                 {
00578                   log_write ("save_kb_backup failed : %s", strerror (errno));
00579                   close (fd_src);
00580                   close (fd_dst);
00581                   goto failed;
00582                 }
00583               m += e;
00584             }
00585           bzero (buf, sizeof (buf));
00586         }
00587     }
00588   else
00589     log_write ("save_kb_backup failed : %s\n", strerror (errno));
00590 
00591   close (fd_src);
00592   close (fd_dst);
00593   efree (&newname);
00594   file_unlock (fname);
00595   efree (&fname);
00596   return 0;
00597 failed:
00598   file_unlock (fname);
00599 failed1:
00600   efree (&fname);
00601   efree (&newname);
00602   return -1;
00603 }
00604 
00605 
00612 kb_t
00613 save_kb_load_kb (struct arglist *globals, char *hostname)
00614 {
00615   char *fname = kb_fname (hostname);
00616   FILE *f;
00617   int fd;
00618   kb_t kb;
00619   char buf[4096];
00620   long max_age = 864000;
00621 
00622   if (file_locked (fname))
00623     {
00624       efree (&fname);
00625       return NULL;
00626     }
00627   f = fopen (fname, "r");
00628   if (!f)
00629     {
00630       log_write ("Could not open %s - kb won't be restored for %s\n",
00631                  fname, hostname);
00632       efree (&fname);
00633       return NULL;
00634     }
00635   bzero (buf, sizeof (buf));
00636   if (fgets (buf, sizeof (buf) - 1, f) == NULL)
00637     {
00638       log_write ("Could not read %s - kb won't be restored for %s\n",
00639                  fname, hostname);
00640       efree (&fname);
00641       fclose (f);
00642       return NULL;
00643     }
00644 
00645   kb = kb_new ();
00646 
00647   /* Ignore the date */
00648   bzero (buf, sizeof (buf));
00649 
00650   while (fgets (buf, sizeof (buf) - 1, f))
00651     {
00652       int type;
00653       char *name, *value, *t;
00654       struct timeval then, now;
00655 
00656       buf[strlen (buf) - 1] = '\0';     /* chomp(buf) */
00657       t = strchr (buf, ' ');
00658       if (!t)
00659         continue;
00660 
00661       t[0] = '\0';
00662 
00663       then.tv_sec = atol (buf);
00664       t[0] = ' ';
00665       t++;
00666       type = atoi (t);
00667       t = strchr (t, ' ');
00668       if (!t)
00669         continue;
00670 
00671       t[0] = ' ';
00672       t++;
00673       name = t;
00674       t = strchr (name, '=');
00675       if (!t)
00676         continue;
00677 
00678       t[0] = '\0';
00679       name = strdup (name);
00680       t[0] = ' ';
00681       t++;
00682       value = strdup (t);
00683 
00684       if (strcmp (name, "Host/dead") && strncmp (name, "/tmp/", 4)
00685           && strcmp (name, "Host/ping_failed"))
00686         {
00687           gettimeofday (&now, NULL);
00688           if (now.tv_sec - then.tv_sec > max_age)
00689             {
00690               /*
00691                  log_write("discarding %s because it's too old\n",
00692                  name,
00693                  (now.tv_sec - then.tv_sec));
00694                */
00695             }
00696           else
00697             {
00698               if (type == ARG_STRING)
00699                 {
00700                   char *tmp = rmslashes (value);
00701                   kb_item_add_str (kb, name, tmp);
00702                   efree (&tmp);
00703                 }
00704               else if (type == ARG_INT)
00705                 kb_item_add_int (kb, name, atoi (value));
00706             }
00707         }
00708       efree (&value);
00709       efree (&name);
00710       bzero (buf, sizeof (buf));
00711     }
00712   fclose (f);
00713 
00714   /*
00715    * Re-open the file
00716    */
00717   fd = open (fname, O_RDWR);
00718   efree (&fname);
00719   if (fd > 0)
00720     {
00721       lseek (fd, 0, SEEK_END);
00722       if (arg_get_value (globals, "save_kb"))
00723         arg_set_value (globals, "save_kb", ARG_INT, GSIZE_TO_POINTER (fd));
00724       else
00725         arg_add_value (globals, "save_kb", ARG_INT, sizeof (gpointer),
00726                        GSIZE_TO_POINTER (fd));
00727     }
00728   else
00729     log_write ("ERROR - %s\n", strerror (errno));
00730   return kb;
00731 }
00732 
00739 int
00740 save_kb (struct arglist *globals)
00741 {
00742   char *value;
00743 
00744   if (!globals)
00745     return 0;
00746 
00747   value = arg_get_value (globals, "network_scan_status");
00748   if (value && !strcmp (value, "busy"))
00749     return 1;
00750 
00751   return 0;
00752 }
